sentences.en: During childhood each of us has to navigate a pathway through a series of developmental stages.
sentences.cn: 我们每个人在童年时都要经历和应对不同的成长阶段。

sentences.en: He has to learn to navigate by electronic instruments.
sentences.cn: 他得学会用电子仪器导航.

sentences.en: I don't like having to navigate London's crowded streets.
sentences.cn: 我不愿意在伦敦拥挤的街道上穿行.

sentences.en: If guests wished to use the sofa, they had first to navigate around chairs in the middle of the room.
sentences.cn: 如果客人想坐沙发，他们得先绕过屋中间的那几把椅子。

sentences.en: In tests, the bees navigate back home after being placed in a field a mile away.
sentences.cn: 在多次试验中，放置于一英里以外田野中的蜜蜂都能飞回蜂巢。

sentences.en: In the corridors he let her navigate her own way round the trolleys and other obstacles.
sentences.cn: 在通道里，他让她自己小心地绕过小推车和其他障碍物。

sentences.en: Many believe this is the trickiest area to navigate.
sentences.cn: 很多人认为这是最难驾驭的领域.
大多数蝙蝠靠回声定位来飞行。

sentences.en: Pigeons navigate less accurately when the earth's magnetic field is disturbed.
sentences.cn: 地球磁场受到干扰时,鸽子的道航能力就会变得不准确.

sentences.en: Such boats can navigate on the Nile.
sentences.cn: 这种船可以在尼罗河上航行。

sentences.en: The first vehicles to navigate the air were balloons.
sentences.cn: 首次在空中航行的飞行器是气球.

sentences.en: The purpose of the visit was to navigate into an ice-filled fiord.
sentences.cn: 这次出行是为了能驶入冰雪覆盖的峡湾。

sentences.en: The river is too dangerous to navigate.
sentences.cn: 这河道太危险，不适宜航行。

sentences.en: This outlook helped her to navigate through her later years with success.
sentences.cn: 这种观念帮她安度了晚年。

sentences.en: When travelling on fast roads at night it is impossible to drive and navigate at the same time.
sentences.cn: 晚上在高速路上行驶时根本做不到边开车边找路。

words.tran_cn: 可航行的；可驾驶的；适于航行的

trans.tran_cn: 导航，确定路线，航行，航海，小心翼翼地绕过(障碍)，驾驭，成功应付(困难处境)
trans.tran_en: to sail along a river or other area of water
